decks.notes: This deck focuses on quickly dealing lethal poison damage to the opponent using Infect creatures like Glistener Elf and Blighted Agent, along with pump spells like Invigorate, Berserk, and Become Immense. The deck also includes protection in the form of countermagic like Force of Will and Spell Pierce, as well as disruption with cards like Daze and Wasteland. The goal is to use efficient creatures and spells to overwhelm the opponent and win the game before they have a chance to mount a defense.

This deck aims to quickly fill up the graveyard with powerful creatures using cards like Careful Study and Entomb, in order to bring them back onto the battlefield with spells like Reanimate and Animate Dead. The key strategy is to cheat out creatures like Griselbrand and Iona, Shield of Emeria, overwhelming the opponent with powerful threats early in the game and disrupting their plans with counter spells like Force of Will. Overall, the deck focuses on fast and explosive plays to overwhelm the opponent and win the game through powerful reanimation combos.

The deck focuses on assembling a large board of Elf creatures that generate mana quickly and efficiently. It uses various mana dorks like Deathrite Shaman, Heritage Druid, and Nettle Sentinel to ramp into powerful threats such as Craterhoof Behemoth and Shaman of the Pack. The deck also includes card draw in Elvish Visionary and Glimpse of Nature to maintain card advantage and combo off. The mana base includes Gaea's Cradle and Cavern of Souls to support the Elf tribal theme. Overall, the deck aims to overwhelm opponents with its explosive combo potential.

The main concept of this deck is to overwhelm the opponent with a quick and aggressive Goblin tribal strategy. Utilizing cards like Goblin Lackey and Goblin Warchief to cheat out creatures faster, combined with powerful goblins like Goblin Piledriver and Krenko, Mob Boss to deal massive damage. The inclusion of cards like Aether Vial and Cavern of Souls help to protect and support the goblin synergy. Wasteland and Rishadan Port are used to disrupt the opponent's mana base while maintaining pressure on the board.

This deck focuses on controlling the game through a combination of counterspells, removal, and card advantage. By utilizing powerful planeswalkers like Jace, the Mind Sculptor and versatile creatures like Snapcaster Mage and Vendilion Clique, the player aims to outvalue and outmaneuver their opponent. With cards like Sensei's Divining Top and Counterbalance, the deck can control the top of their library and counter spells effectively. The inclusion of sweepers like Terminus and removal spells like Swords to Plowshares ensures the player can handle a variety of threats, ultimately leading to victory through superior resource management and strategy.

The main concept of this deck is to utilize fast mana acceleration and card filtering to cast multiple spells in a single turn, building up a storm count to play Tendrils of Agony for lethal damage. The deck aims to efficiently chain together spells like Dark Ritual, Cabal Ritual, and Infernal Tutor to generate mana and dig through the deck for the necessary combo pieces. Cabal Therapy and Duress help disrupt the opponent's game plan, while Ad Nauseam can be used as a high-risk, high-reward card draw engine. The goal is to overwhelm the opponent with a massive storm spell finish.

The deck is focused on playing aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets and Tarmogoyf, supported by disruptive spells like Force of Will and Stifle. It aims to control the board with cards like Abrupt Decay and Daze while also applying pressure with efficient creatures. The deck also utilizes card selection through spells like Ponder and Brainstorm to find the necessary pieces to secure victory. Additionally, the inclusion of mana denial with Wasteland and disruption with cards like Spell Pierce helps to disrupt the opponent's game plan.

The deck focuses on quickly filling the graveyard with powerful creatures like Griselbrand and Emrakul, then using cards like Reanimate and Goryo's Vengeance to bring them back onto the battlefield. It also includes cards like Dark Ritual and Lotus Petal to generate mana quickly, along with card selection and disruption spells like Brainstorm and Thoughtseize to help set up the combo. The goal is to quickly reanimate a powerful threat and overwhelm the opponent before they can recover, making it a potent and aggressive combo deck in the Legacy format.

This deck is focused on quickly dealing damage to the opponent with a mix of aggressive creatures and burn spells. The goal is to apply pressure early with cards like Goblin Guide and Monastery Swiftspear while using spells like Lightning Bolt, Lava Spike, and Chain Lightning to finish off the opponent. Eidolon of the Great Revel punishes opponents for playing spells, and Price of Progress can deal massive damage if the opponent is running nonbasic lands. Sulfuric Vortex provides a way to finish off opponents even if they stabilize the board.

The key concept of this Eldrazi Aggro deck is to quickly play powerful Eldrazi creatures such as Reality Smasher and Thought-Knot Seer by using mana acceleration from Ancient Tomb, Eldrazi Temple, and Eye of Ugin. The deck also aims to disrupt opponent's game plan with cards like Chalice of the Void and Thorn of Amethyst while utilizing Wasteland to control opponent's mana base. The deck's strategy revolves around applying early pressure and overwhelming the opponent with efficient creatures and disruptive spells.

This combo deck focuses on generating mana and card advantage with cards like Glimpse of Nature and Heritage Druid, allowing for explosive plays. The main goal is to flood the board with Elf creatures, then use Natural Order or Green Sun's Zenith to search for and bring out Craterhoof Behemoth for a massive attack. The deck also utilizes bounce effects like Wirewood Symbiote and Quirion Ranger to reuse key creatures and maximize mana production. Overall, the strategy hinges on quickly building a strong Elf board presence and overwhelming the opponent in a single turn.

The main concept of this Grixis Aggro Legacy deck is to utilize efficient and low-cost spells like Brainstorm, Daze, and Force of Will to control the game early on while ramping up aggression with Lightning Bolt and creatures like Delver of Secrets, Young Pyromancer, and Gurmag Angler. The deck also includes disruption with Cabal Therapy and disruption with wasteland. By combining disruption, card advantage, and aggressive creatures, this deck aims to apply pressure on the opponent and control the tempo of the game to secure a victory.

The main focus of this deck is to utilize the Dredge mechanic to fill the graveyard quickly with powerful creatures and trigger abilities. By dredging cards like Golgari Grave-Troll and Stinkweed Imp, the deck can put multiple cards from the library into the graveyard each turn. This allows for explosive plays with cards like Bridge from Below and Dread Return, ultimately aiming to bring out high-impact threats like Flayer of the Hatebound for a game-winning combo. Additionally, cards like Cabal Therapy help disrupt the opponent's game plan while advancing the deck's own strategy.

This deck focuses on utilizing efficient creatures and disruption spells to control the board and pressure the opponent. By combining aggressive threats like Tarmogoyf and Shardless Agent with powerful planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and Jace, the Mind Sculptor, it aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage. The deck also includes versatile removal spells like Abrupt Decay and Toxic Deluge to deal with opposing threats. With a solid mana base and a mix of disruption and threats, this deck aims to outvalue and outpace the opponent in a midrange battle.

The deck focuses on quickly generating mana and casting a large number of spells in one turn to build up storm count. By using cards like Lion's Eye Diamond and Lotus Petal, along with rituals like Cabal Ritual and Dark Ritual, the deck aims to generate enough mana to cast a lethal Tendrils of Agony or Ad Nauseam. The deck also includes disruption with cards like Cabal Therapy and Duress to protect the combo and clear the way for a successful storm turn to win the game.

The main goal of this deck is to quickly play aggressive creatures like Delver of Secrets, Monastery Swiftspear, and Stormchaser Mage, while disrupting the opponent's game plan with cards like Force of Will and Spell Pierce. Using efficient burn spells like Lightning Bolt and Price of Progress, the deck aims to put pressure on the opponent and finish the game quickly. With cantrips like Ponder and Gitaxian Probe to find threats and answers, along with a solid mana base of fetch lands and dual lands, this deck is designed to be a fast and powerful tempo deck in the Legacy format.
